com.rigado.rigablue

Class RigDfuError

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.rigado.rigablue.RigDfuError

  • public class RigDfuError
extends java.lang.Object
    Instances of RigDfuError are passed to callbacks when a bootloader operation fails. They contain a description of the specific error that occurred.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int BAD_DEVICE
      An invalid/null value was encountered where a RigLeBaseDevice was expected
      static int BAD_PERIPHERAL
      An invalid/null value was encountered where an Android BluetoothDevice was expected
      static int BOOTLOADER_DISCONNECT
      Called if the bootloader fails to connect or if it disconnects during the update process.
      static int CONNECTION_FAILED 
      static int CONNECTION_TIMEOUT 
      static int CONTROL_POINT_CHARACTERISTIC_MISSING
      Unused in iOS
      static int COULD_NOT_CONNECT
      This means that the update manager could not connect to RigDfu.
      static int DISCOVERY_TIMEOUT 
      static int FIRMWARE_UPDATE_CANCELLED
      An in progress firmware update was cancelled by the user.
      static int FIRMWARE_VALIDATION_INIT_FAILURE
      Unused
      static int IMAGE_ACTIVATION_FAILURE
      Failed to activate the firmware.
      static int IMAGE_VALIDATION_FAILURE
      Failed to validate the firmware image after a successful transfer.
      static int INVALID_PARAMETER
      The firmware update request was initialized with a null parameter
      static int PATCH_CURRENT_IMAGE_CRC_FAILURE
      The CRC of the image on the device before patching does not match the expected CRC.
      static int PATCH_INIT_WRITE_FAILURE
      Unused
      static int PERIPHERAL_NOT_SET
      Not currently used.
      static int POST_PATCH_IMAGE_CRC_FAILURE
      Replaces error IMAGE_VALIDATION_FAILURE for patch binaries.
      static int UNKNOWN_ERROR
      An unknown error occurred.

      • INVALID_PARAMETER

        public static final int INVALID_PARAMETER
        The firmware update request was initialized with a null parameter
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • IMAGE_VALIDATION_FAILURE

        public static final int IMAGE_VALIDATION_FAILURE
        Failed to validate the firmware image after a successful transfer. It is possible that trying again may fix it.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • IMAGE_ACTIVATION_FAILURE

        public static final int IMAGE_ACTIVATION_FAILURE
        Failed to activate the firmware. It is possible that trying again may fix it.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PATCH_CURRENT_IMAGE_CRC_FAILURE

        public static final int PATCH_CURRENT_IMAGE_CRC_FAILURE
        The CRC of the image on the device before patching does not match the expected CRC. This is an unrecoverable error that has to do with having the wrong patch file.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • POST_PATCH_IMAGE_CRC_FAILURE

        public static final int POST_PATCH_IMAGE_CRC_FAILURE
        Replaces error IMAGE_VALIDATION_FAILURE for patch binaries. This means that the CRC of the firmware after patching did not match the expected CRC. Retrying may recover from this error, but unlikely.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • COULD_NOT_CONNECT

        public static final int COULD_NOT_CONNECT
        This means that the update manager could not connect to RigDfu. Currently unused, we handle connection failures with CONNECTION_FAILED, CONNECTION_TIMEOUT, and BOOTLOADER_DISCONNECT
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • UNKNOWN_ERROR

        public static final int UNKNOWN_ERROR
        An unknown error occurred.
        See Also:

    • Method Detail

      • getErrorMessage

        public java.lang.String getErrorMessage()
        Returns:
        A more detailed description of the error

      • getErrorCode

        public int getErrorCode()
        Returns:
        The defined error code

      • errorFromCode

        public static RigDfuError errorFromCode(int errorCode)
        Parameters:
        errorCode - The defined error code
        Returns:
        An instance of RigDfuError that contains the specified errorCode and its associated error message. A default error message is returned if the errorCode is invalid.
